intro: Teucrium bracteatum, commonly known as the purple germander, is a flowering plant native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually purple or violet in color, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped, slightly hairy, and have a strong, aromatic scent. Teucrium bracteatum is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands.
